cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles SSW of Caibari√©n, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to begin a WNW turn overnight, then curve NW this weekend while moving along or just north of Cuba toward the Florida Keys and the eastern Gulf of Mexico.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend / eastern Florida Panhandle

weather_observation.watch_coast: Southwest coast of Florida from Englewood south and east to Ocean Reef
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys west of Ocean Reef to the Dry Tortugas, including Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North coast of central Cuba, the Florida Keys, and the west coast of Florida northward into the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: No significant tropical-storm-force winds expected at San Juan, PR within the next 5 days.
weather_observation.rainfall: Any remaining showers are expected to be scattered and below hazardous thresholds as Fred has moved well west of Puerto Rico.
